ncsa.hdf.view
Class TreeView

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--java.awt.Component
        |
        +--java.awt.Container
              |
              +--javax.swing.JComponent
                    |
                    +--javax.swing.JPanel
                          |
                          +--ncsa.hdf.view.TreeView
All Implemented Interfaces:
javax.accessibility.Accessible, java.awt.event.ActionListener, java.util.EventListener, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable
public class TreeView
extends javax.swing.JPanel
implements java.awt.event.ActionListener

TreeView displays the structure of an HDF4/5 file in a tree with data groups and data objects represented as conventional folders and icons. Users can easily expand or collapse folders to navigate the hierarchical structure of the HDF file. The HDF4/5 group structure is a direct graph. To break loops of the graph, the TreeView disables the groups with loops. So that folders of looped groups cannot be expanded.

The TreeView allows users to browse through any HDF4/5 file; starting with all top-level objects in the file's hierarchy. The TreeView allows a user to descend through the hierarchy and navigate among the file's data objects. The content of a data object is loaded only when the object is selected, providing interactive and efficient access to HDF files.

The TreeView is used to perform editing action on the file structure and update the change in file and memory. Users can add new data object or delete existing data object/group from the tree. After an object is successfully added or deleted from the file, the change of the structure will also reflect in TreeView.

Version:
1.3.0 01/10/2002
Author:
Peter X. Cao
See Also:
ViewManager, Serialized Form
